Articles.Content: I trust Trekkette to not give them biological USB. Seriously, the worst part of that film.

Here are some creatures i did a while back and i tried to go for a complete different anatomy (sorry for the horrible Pictures):

This is some kind of large aquatic creature:

And this is something that flies and catches small, insect like creatures with a long tounge:

Eh, I'm trying to imagine a Moon that's mostly Ocean having a pandora ecology...It's not working. Unless your specifically talking about the land creatures.

@Canopus: Well, that put me to shame. I could describe what a creature should somewhat look like and have you draw it.

They also look like they'd go quite well with the artistic style of PfL. I think you are now the entitled creature artist.

Back to brain storming for me. If you want an Idea for a sea creature PM me Canopus.

Edited June 7, 2013 by Rage097

@Canopus: Well, that put me to shame. I could describe what a creature should somewhat look like and have you draw it.
I'm currently learning Adobe illustrator so i could really scan and colorize them. Maybe we could do something like this then? Maybe i'm just creature designer, the better artist is till chobit Edited June 7, 2013 by Canopus
Actually, the Pandora jungle was inspired by coral reefs. I can imagine Pandora-like reefs rather well.

I'm currently learning Adobe illustrator so i could really scan and colorize them. Maybe we could do something like this then?

Sounds good!

Rage and i came up with this:

if it lives in groups it will be called "Swarmadillo"

no armadillos?, good as i can use

which is a killadillo
...I didn't come up with the name. Unless Laythe now has an Armadillo based ecology. Lol.

...I didn't come up with the name. Unless Laythe now has an Armadillo based ecology. Lol.
Everyone wanted an Armadillo
We need Chobit and Trekkette to clear all this up and explain it.

We need Chobit and Trekkette to clear all this up and explain it.
Explain what?
Leon we're brainstorming Wildlife for Laythe.
To make sense of all this. My head hurts...

Okay, this is what I've got for animal and plant life for the PfL-Verse:

Kerbol: It's a star... you figure it out.

Moho: Nothing

Eve: Basic algae and microbial life in the shallows of the seas. No life on land

Gilly: Nothing

Kerbin: Very Earth-like life, only a few minor differences

Mun: Nothing

Minmus: Nothing

Duna: Very rare bacterial life deep underground

Ike: Nothing

Dres: Nothing

Jool: Nothing

Laythe: Vast aquatic ecosystems and other crazy alien fish. Surface life is all beach-based, nothing inland

Vall: Nothing

Tylo: Nothing

Bop: Nothing

Pol: Nothing

Eeloo: *CLASSIFIED*

Yet another classified. Toblerone Chobit?

And what about the Krakens on Bop?

What? You show us Laythe as a planet with mass rain forests inland...And there's no animal life? I guess I'll be thinking of giant alien crabs.

GIANT ENEMY CRAB

Also: what do you think of Canopus's animal suggestion drawing a few pages prior?

What? You show us Laythe as a planet with mass rain forests inland...And there's no animal life? I guess I'll be thinking of giant alien crabs.

GIANT ENEMY CRAB

I guess all of the other pictures show Kerbin.

@chobit what do you think about my creatures?
Those can be easily implimated, and the images with rainforests are on kerbin you derp

...

Excuse my idiocy.
I also thought that was Laythe. Actually justified, you two have been calling it a tropical retreat.

Here's your Beach-based life

GIANT ENEMY CRAB
That's going to be a nice surprise for them when they land.

*Freya shoots one dozens of times, it finally dies*

Freya: Well then. Crab for dinner, anyone?

Dariya: Ooooh, I know this great recipe!

*Nadari facepalms*

*Freya shoots one dozens of times, it finally dies*

Freya: Well then. Crab for dinner, anyone?

Dariya: Ooooh, I know this great recipe!

*Nadari facepalms*

All of my yes^

All of it.
